title.narrative: Perceptions of a Pandemic: Strengthening the quality and relevance of the COVID-19 global response through community input

description.narrative:
Response wide COVID – 19 GLOBAL SUPPORT community perception.
Communication with and accountability to communities affected by the crisis

To better understand how information on COVID-19 has reached populations in several observed and affected countries and influenced trust, behaviour and economic status. The ongoing response is informed by and adapted to the perspectives of affected and at-risk communities in humanitarian settings, at both national and global levels. Global perceptions trend analysis helps to inform global research and learning for future emergencies and the ongoing response to COVID-19 into the future
Target group will be affected people in Syria, Uganda, Iraq, Bangladesh, and Somalia.

Expense for H2H Covid starting from June 2020
(SGA ref: H2H_2020_CV2_1_GTS)
Finance staff - Financial Reporting, payments - 7%
Executive Director - Quality assurance and advocacy - 5%
Programme Manager - Project Management - 2 staff x 70%
